name: CompleteReservationCleanup
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

request_samples.name: CURL

E.name: ID
E.description: This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

C.name: Lines
C.description:
Every line on the cleanup task must be represented in this collection and each line must have an indication what needs
to happen to it in the context of the cleanup. The options are:

- The product was returned, in which case QuantityReturned must have a value.
- There was nothing there to return, in which case NothingToReturn must be set to true. A cyclecount will be generated for the product to make sure.
- The reservation must be extended, in which case ReservationExpirationOverride must have a value.

C.name: UserTaskID
C.description: This is the ID of a `UserTask`

B.name: CreateNewTaskForRemainingLines
B.description:
Can be set to true so that lines missing from the workset are copied to a new cleanup task, so these can be done at a later point in time. This is
useful when the employee is handling a large order and wants to move a single batch first.

B.name: NoConfirmation
B.description:
Should be set to true when the user did not confirm the order or user task (by means of a barcode scan or something). When set to true, the user will
be required to have (or be elevated for) the functionality `CompleteReservationCleanupWithoutConfirmation`.

G.name: Code
G.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

G.name: Message
G.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

G.name: RequestID
G.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

G.name: Type
G.description: A short description of the error type.

H.name: ExternalIDs
H.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

H.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
H.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

H.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
H.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
